summary: Schizotypal personality disorder (SPD) is a mental health condition where people have trouble connecting with others. They might feel like others are against them or think strangely. People with SPD may act or talk in unusual ways and often believe in things that aren't normally considered real. They might not even realize they have a problem, instead seeking help for feelings of sadness or fear. It's more common in men and affects around 3% of people.
title: Schizotypal personality disorder
